text: The Solomon River is a U.S. Geological Survey. National Hydrography Dataset high-resolution flowline data. The National Map , accessed March 29, 2011 river in the central Great Plains of North America. The entire river in the U.S. state of Kansas. It is a tributary of the Smoky Hill River. ==Names== The Native name for the river was Nepaholla. It meant "Water on the Hill". This is a reference to Waconda Spring, which was in the river valley. ==References== Category:Rivers of Kansas
title: Solomon River
